attributes.action: Stop the health and care bill 2021
attributes.additional_details: The NHS Act, brought before parliament in 1946, was created as part of a social welfare policy under Clement Atlee's Labour government which aimed to provide universal and free benefits to all those in need. The Health & Care Bill 2021 is the slow dismantling of the NHS, the American health care system fails the poorest in its community if we adopt it the most needy will be plunged back into Dickensian conditions.
attributes.background: Reinstate the clause banning any agreement that “undermines or restricts” the UK's ability to provide “a comprehensive publicly funded health service free at the point of delivery”. The NHS is not for sale and needs to be protected not stripped down and sold off to the highest bidder.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the Health and Care Bill, but it's not clear if you want this to be stopped or amended.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Protect the NHS, Press Pause on the White Paper for Health and Social care: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581077
